title: Here's everything new on Hulu in November 2022 — and what's leaving; Get ready for the Jerry Falwell Jr. documentary 'God Forbid,' Kumail Nanjiani in the crime drama 'Welcome to Chippendales' and Jesse Eisenberg in the relationship drama 'Fleishman Is in Trouble'
text:
The topic of scandal continues with the true-crime series "Welcome to Chippendales" (Nov. 22), starring Kumail Nanjiani as the immigrant founder of the 1980s male-stripper franchise, which chronicles his business empire's rise and fall amid a blizzard of sex, drugs and violence.

And speaking of sex, there's also FX's "Fleishman Is in Trouble" (Nov. 17), starring Jesse Eisenberg as a newly divorced dad whose promiscuous dive into app-based dating is disrupted when his ex-wife disappears and leaves him with their kids. Claire Danes, Lizzy Caplan and Adam Brody co-star in the eight-episode drama, which is based on Taffy Brodesser-Akner's best-selling novel.

Also: See more monthly streaming picks at What's Worth Streaming

The Disney DIS-controlled streaming service also has a ton of holiday-themed movies on the way, as well as favorites such as "Can't Hardly Wait," "Mamma Mia!," "Office Space," "The Perks of Being a Wallflower" and "Shaun of the Dead" (all Nov. 1).

Here's the complete list of what's coming and going, as of Oct. 18 (release dates are subject to change):
